vc.prottype: FWLIBAPI short WINAPI cnc_rdpitchr(unsigned short FlibHndl, short s_number, short e_number, short length, IODBPI *pitch);

cmn.p: Reads the pitch error compensation data specified by "s_number", "e_number". The data is stored in "data" array of "IODBPI" with signed binary format.

is.p: Reads the pitch error compensation data specified by "s_number", "e_number". The data is stored in "data" array of "IODBPI" with signed binary format.

content.p: Specify the library handle. See "Library handle" for details.
Specify the start number of the pitch error compensation data.
Specify the end number of the pitch error compensation data.
Specify the data block length (size of IODBPI structure).
N : Number of pitch error compensation data
Pointer to the IODBPI structure including the pitch error compensation data. The IODBPI structure is as follows.

item.name: EW_LENGTH
item.content:
Data block length error
Size of IODBPI structure(length) is wrong.

item.name: EW_NUMBER
item.content:
Data number error
Pitch error compensation data number(s_number, e_number) is wrong.

item.name: EW_NOOPT
item.content:
No option
This function needs the pitch error compensation option.

option.hssb: The extended driver/library function is necessary.

ethr.p: The Ethernet function and the extended driver/library function are necessary.
However, in case of Series 16i/18i/21i-B, 0i-B/C/D/F, Series 30i and PMi-A, the required CNC option is as follows.

p.ul: above two optional functions are not required.

type.p:
Bi-directional pitch error compensation
Extended bi-directional pitch error compensation

is.hssb: The pitch error compensation option and the extended driver/library function are necessary.

type.p:
Bi-directional pitch error compensation
Extended bi-directional pitch error compensation

type.add: When you use the Bi-directional pitch error compensation : No.3605#0
